舉.definition: to lift; to hold up; to cite; to enumerate; to act; to raise; to choose; to elect; act; move; deed

舉一反三.definition: to raise one and infer three; to deduce many things from one case (idiom)

舉世.definition: throughout the world; world ranking (e.g. first)

舉世無雙.definition: unrivaled (idiom); world number one; unique; unequaled

舉人.definition: graduate; successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination

舉債.definition: to raise a loan; to borrow money

舉兵.definition: (literary) to raise an army; to dispatch troops

舉凡.definition: such things as ...; examples including ... (etc); without exception; every; any

舉國上下.definition: the entire nation; the whole country, from the leadership to the rank and file

舉報.definition: to report (malefactors to the police); to denounce

舉手.definition: to raise a hand; to put up one's hand (as signal)

舉手之勞.definition: lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom); fig. a very slight effort

舉杯.definition: to toast sb (with wine etc); to drink a toast

舉案齊眉.definition: lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage

舉棋不定.definition: to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver; to shilly-shally

舉業.definition: preparatory literary studies for imperial examination

舉步維艱.definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)

舉用.definition: to select the best (for a job)

舉發.definition: to expose (e.g., wrongdoing); to accuse (in court); to impeach; to denounce

舉目.definition: to look; to raise one's eyes

舉目無親.definition: to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on; without a friend in the world

舉賢良對策.definition: Treatise 134 BC by Han dynasty philosopher Dong Zhongshu 董仲舒

舉起.definition: to heave; to lift; to raise up; to uphold

舉足輕重.definition: to play a critical role (idiom); influential
